The world would have to redefine laws and policies to recognize animals as legal entities with the capacity to hold rights and interests.
Animals would have the right to sue and be sued in court, and their welfare would be protected by law.
Animals would have the right to privacy, and their personal information would be protected.
Animals would have the right to vote and participate in political decision-making processes.
The concept of "ownership" of animals would be reevaluated, and it may become illegal to use them for exploitative purposes such as hunting, breeding, or experimentation without their consent.
